title: National Crime Victims’ Rights Week (April 10-16, 2011)
body:
In observance of National Crime Victims’ Rights Week (April 10-16, 2011), the ’s  remembers all victims of crime.  We would also like to honor surviving family members of homicide victims.  In 2010, officers of the ’s County Police Department received training on the roles and responsibilities of law enforcement regarding Crime Victims’ Rights.  The agency has significantly expanded its victim services program and now has a victim advocate assigned to each District Station, Criminal Investigations Division and at a walk-in bilingual clinic housed in the Langley Park COPS office.    The ’s County Police Department is committed to treating victims of crime with dignity, respect and sensitivity, as we continue to fight crime and serve the citizen’s of our county.
